intro: Silene roemeri var. balcanica, commonly known as the Balkan campion, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are arranged in a raceme. Silene roemeri var. balcanica is a perennial herb that plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
